text: Studies in American Indian Literatures is a quarterly peer-reviewed academic journal covering Native American literature. It is published by the University of Nebraska Press on behalf of the Association for the Study of American Indian Literatures. == History == The journal was established in 1977 as the Newsletter of the Association for the Study of American Indian Literatures and changed to ASAIL Newsletter in 1978 before the journal obtained its current title in 1980. Publication was interrupted from 1987 to 1989. == Abstracting and indexing == The journal is abstracted and indexed in the Arts and Humanities Citation Index, Current Contents/Arts & Humanities, and Scopus. == References == == External links == * Category:Literary magazines published in the United States Category:American studies journals Category:English-language journals Category:Native American literature Category:Publications established in 1977 Category:Quarterly journals Category:University of Nebraska–Lincoln
